title.narrative: 1.9 PPL CHILD SURVIVAL

description.narrative: 1.9 Women and Children, especially the most vulnerable and marginalized, increasingly use improved quality maternal, child health and nutrition services, and apply improved health practices., which contributes to Child Health, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Hygiene, Immunization, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Micronutrients, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Polio Eradication, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Sanitation, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water Supply, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1. By the end of 2022, most disadvantaged children have access to enhanced health and nutrition practices2. Sustained use of safe water supply and sanitation services, and adoption of hygiene practices, by children and their families in poor communities vulnerable to climate change, conflict and public health emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.9 Women and Children, especially the most vulnerable and marginalized, increasingly use improved quality maternal, child healthand nutrition services, and apply improved health practices.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued to ensure access to child survival services, including health, nutrition and hygiene promotion services, to the most vulnerable Palestinian children and mothers in Lebanon. Significant improvements in the quality of health and WASH services were achieved in partnership with UNRWA and CSO Partners.In response to COVID-19 pandemic, UNICEF’s Palestinian Programme launched the COVID-19 vaccine awareness campaign in March 2021 targeting Palestinian camps and gatherings across Lebanon, with the aim of raising awareness about the vaccines and encouraging Palestine refugees to register for the vaccination. 380 youth volunteers and 52 women leaders participated in the campaign.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/12/2021
